@TheContrarianOne It is not bizarre. $ZIM benefited in 2021 and 2022 from abnormally high prices for shipping containers. Those prices have come back to earth and the company's outsized profits have disappeared.
There are a lot of people on stocktwits that refuse to believe that and still dream of future $6 dividends. The earnings for Q1 2023 are supposed to be only about 25% of Q4 2022 earnings.
Read the Q4 earnings announcement and notice how they forecast the profit for the whole of 2023 to be less than the profit for Q4 2022.
Once you take that into account
created_at: the pricing starts to make sense. A lot of people are simply waiting to see the Q1 earnings and get a feel of expectations for the future
